sentences.english: He was surprised when he stole an exhibit from the museum.
sentences.chinese: 当他从博物馆偷盗一件展品时被当场捉住。

sentences.english: But after we had started to uphold the precept of not stealing, our lung and nose problesm will gradually diminish.
sentences.chinese: 当我们持守不偷盗戒后，肺部和鼻子只出些小毛病。
是的，我们认同那是偷盗。

sentences.english: Both boys pleaded guilty to the theft charge and face sentencing at a later date.
sentences.chinese: 这两名男孩对该偷盗指控供认不讳，并将被择日宣判。

sentences.english: People sat by idly and remained indifferent to the theft on the bus.
sentences.chinese: 面对公交车上的偷盗行为，大家都坐视不理。

sentences.english: Never lie, cheat or steal, always strike a fair deal.
sentences.chinese: 决不撒谎，欺瞒或偷盗，坚守平允买卖。

sentences.english: On returning home after work, he found that his house was burglarized.
sentences.chinese: 下班回家后，他发现他的家被偷盗了。

sentences.english: A few protesters were reported to have been arrested on charges of theft or vandalism.
sentences.chinese: 据报道，一些反抗者们因为偷盗或者破坏公物被捕。

sentences.english: After the burglary I had all the locks convertd.
sentences.chinese: 在受到偷盗之后，我把所有的锁都换了。

sentences.english: He wanted to be accused of larceny, because he felt comfortable in prison.
sentences.chinese: 他希望被判成偷盗罪，因为他觉得监狱里过得舒服。

sentences.english: Taking credit for other people's work is a form of lying and stealing.
sentences.chinese: 把别人的功劳归到自己名下是撒谎和偷盗的一种形式。

sentences.english: Never lie,cheat or steal,always strike a fair deal.
sentences.chinese: 决不撒谎，欺瞒或偷盗，坚守公平交易。

sentences.english: What I want to ask, relates stealing the benefit?
sentences.chinese: 我想问的是，关系到偷盗者的利益吗？

sentences.english: If in the past we had committed robbery and created bad karma, that will cause us to suffer from lungs and nose problems.
sentences.chinese: 譬如前世犯偷盗的罪业会引起肺部和鼻子的毛病。

sentences.english: Carwin was wanted in dublin for theft and murder .
sentences.chinese: 加尔文因偷盗和谋杀正受都柏林方面通辑。

definition: lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
to lose by theft/to have one's property stolen
to pick a lock/to force a lock
to steal sth and sell it
to steal (including identity theft, credit card fraud or theft of computer account)/to misappropriate
